medical_history.chief_complaint: Upper abdominal pain, fevers, and fatigue
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks ago with acute onset of upper abdominal pain described as bilaterally 'like a strip.' The pain led to decreased oral intake and intermittent fevers, although the patient has been afebrile for the past 2 days. Additionally, the patient reports nausea, heartburn, and rigors. There are no changes in bowel movements or presence of bloody bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HTN, Type 2 DM, Anxiety, IBS, OSA (non-adherent with CPAP), hyperlipidemia, left renal cyst, hepatic cysts. Previous history of choledocholithiasis s/p ERCP & sphincterotomy.
medical_history.family_history: CAD, renal disease. Mother has cirrhosis of unknown etiology.
